title: Pointers in C++
subject: C++ Programming
theory:
Same as C, but: 
1. Use `nullptr` instead of `NULL` (Type safe). 
2. Often replaced by References or Smart Pointers only when owning resources.

interview_questions.question: Why nullptr over NULL?
interview_questions.answer: NULL is 0 (int). `f(void*)` and `f(int)` overload can confuse NULL. nullptr is strictly `std::nullptr_t`.
